snippet: Nebraska legislation to limit sales near the Pine Ridge reservation is stuck in a committee whose members have received more than $21,000 from alcohol interests in the last five years.
abstract: Nebraska bill that would curtail alcohol purchases to residents of a dry Indian reservation outside Whiteclay stalls in a key committee whose members have received thousands of dollars in campaign contributions from the alcohol industry; legislation, unlikely to pass, would have granted authorities special powers to combat the devastating effects of alcohol and alcohol-related crime on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation in South Dakota.
lead_paragraph: Nebraska legislation to limit sales near the Pine Ridge reservation is stuck in a committee whose members have received more than $21,000 from alcohol interests in the last five years.

headline.seo: Nebraska Bill on Beer Sales Near Reservation Is Stalled
headline.main: Indian Beer Bill Stalls; Industry Money Flows
headline.print_headline: Indian Beer Bill Stalls; Industry Money Flows
